instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (3178) constantly reboots
threads.message:
I have a Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A) that had water damage, I have cleaned the board with isopropyl and put the board back together and I noticed the below

[LIST=1]
[*]The Green light on the charge stays comes on and the fan spins
[*]The Macbook Starts up and tries to boot in to the OS (Customer put on Windows on a MAC) and then it reboots
[*]The Macbook does not turn on when on battery alone
[*]I can't boot off a USB or press D to get diagnostics
[*]Most if not all water was on the bottom of the board (Board facing the case bottom)
[/LIST]
I don't have a boardview for this motherboard. I am new to macbook repairs so please been patient with me but do know that I have some electronics experience from repairing laptops.

Thanks
Antony

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (3178) constantly reboots
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Post <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> on battery alone (no charger connected).
Also post exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage on charger alone (no battery connected).

[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QRUiEzxFsng2R4116acJsJGMrIgUcGmr/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (3178) constantly reboots
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 0.05 volts on battery only
<SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.42 volts on charger only
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 08.59 volts on charger only
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 1.45 voltage on battery only

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (3178) constantly reboots
threads.message: Now post <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage with both charger and battery connected.

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (3178) constantly reboots
threads.message: Voltage on  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  with both battery and charger connected is Volts 08.59

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (3178) constantly reboots
threads.message:
So battery is not correctly recognized, or is bad.
Try first disconnecting BIL (battery indicator).
Post voltage and diode mode at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

Did you try to boot USB macOS, disconnecting internal SSD?

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (3178) constantly reboots
threads.message: The battery is charging I know this because when I plug in the charger and have the battery connected and leave it for 5 minutes I can see the voltage is higher then before when i did  a previous  testing  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  on battery only, the issue is that the macbook starts up to the operating system and then reboots in an endless cycle.

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (3178) constantly reboots
threads.message:
- Where is the Battery indicator located  (Please indicated what to look for on boardview)
- Where are the SCL/SDA Lines (Please indicated what to look for on boardview)
- I am unable to boot off USB it is not recongnised
- When plug in with charger only the macbook does not turn on, it requires battery and charger plugged  in to turn on

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (3178) constantly reboots
threads.message:
If you get 8.59V with both charger and battery connected, then battery is not charging, or is fully 100% charged.
Do you get green light on magsafe at that moment?

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (3178) constantly reboots
threads.message: Yes Green Light on magsafe and see 3.3 volts at battery terminal

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (3178) constantly reboots
threads.message: I have put in another batter and it shows orange charging light, I will wait to see if it charges

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (3178) constantly reboots
threads.message: What voltage is meant to be at the battery terminal for it to charge ?

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (3178) constantly reboots
threads.message: This one has now been resolved, it turned out they battery was faulty, I cleaned the water damaged from the motherboard as well as replacing the battery and all is now working fine.

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (3178) constantly reboots
threads.message:
Glad to hear is solved.
Always test with known good working parts, to avoid wasting time with working boards.

threads.title: Water Damaged Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (3178) constantly reboots
threads.message: I need to find donor boards, where in china do you guys get your donor boards, Also have you had any of the new macs in yet with the M1 Chip?, I doubt they are going to be repairable much!!!.
